lead_paragraph: In a widely e-mailed "Really?" column from the Science Times this week, Anahad O'Connor reports on a Mayo Clinic study that shows that gargling with salt water can help ease winter colds. Have you ever done this? Did it work for you? What health tips can you share? For instance, do you have a working strategy to lessen the annoyance of the flu, mosquito bites, acne or headaches? Do you have some tips for preventing illness through healthy diet, exercise or stress reduction? Share your advice below.
snippet: Student Opinion | Tell us what health tips have worked for you.

headline.main: What Health Tips Have Worked for You?

abstract: Student Opinion | Tell us what health tips have worked for you.
